The research which was published in the Journal of Food Engineering describes three types of food films based on the well-known naturally occurring seaweed biopolymer sodium alginateâ€”a compound found within the cell walls of brown algae. â€œIts molecules have film-forming propertiesâ€ said Rammohan Aluru senior researcher at the organic synthesis laboratory at Ural Federal University and co-author of the paper. â€œThe greatest advantage of sodium alginate is that it performs as liquid-gel in an aqueous medium.â€ Sounds Tasty!Actually there are other edible food wraps already I believe.Â  The real issue for me is if you eat the wrap it is much the same thing as not having a wrap at all â€”Â you get to eat anything the wrap may have touched.Â  Still it should biodegrade well unlike plastic so it could be mulched instead of landfilled.
